intro: Bowlesia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf bowlesia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. The plant has rounded, waxy leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stem. Native to the mountainous regions of Central America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
